Title: The Musical Brain.
Description:
The Nash Ensemble, one of the world's leading chamber music ensembles, will for the first time present its own festival, from 10th-16th August 2009, at the beautiful venue of Cumberland Lodge, Windsor Great Park. The seven day festival will be programmed by Amelia Freedman, founder of the Nash and one of the most distinguished and respected music programmers of the day.  The festival will include works from throughout the chamber music repertoire, from Mozart to Maxwell Davies, and its audiences will be invited to attend concerts, rehearsals, a masterclass and discussions with the players.  
 
This unique festival presents an ideal opportunity to engage the general concert-going public in a series of scientific lectures, demonstrations, workshops and discussions on the topic of The Musical Brain. Performers, festival-residents and concert audiences will be invited to attend presentations given by distinguished neuroscientists actively engaged in research. Neuroscientists will be invited to give accessible introductions to their specific areas of interest (e.g. rhythm, synchronisation, harmony, emotion, rehabilitation) and will have the extraordinary opportunity to work with the Nash Ensemble who can give live demonstrations of their key points. Lectures and workshops will be integrated with, and illustrated by, the music programme.
 
Internationally renowned neuroscientists are greatly interested in taking part in this project, including Prof. Robert Zatorre (University of Montreal), Dr. Stefan Koelsch (Sussex University) and Dr. Jessica Grahn (Cambridge University). Stephen Johnson (musicologist, writer and broadcaster) and Sir Peter Maxwell Davies (Master of the Queen's Music) are also invited to take part

This will include a military parade and a WW2 street party, the event will be open to local members of the community.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Rememberance, Awareness and Celebration for VE Day
Description: A project to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the end of WW2 with the provision of a remembrance service and open day for members of this community based in Salisbury.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: VE Day Celebration
Description: The St. Leonards and St. Ives Ex-Services Club will use their award to hold a two day event to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the VE Day.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Celebration of the senses
Description: This group uses creativity to educate and inform the public on social issues. This award will be used to fund a two day event including workshops to culminate in an evening of film and performance.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: The Nothe at Nightfall
Description: The award is for a project to stage a two night arts  and heritage festival at Nothe Fort. The grant will include funding for pay for staffing, equipment, artist performances and workshops.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Yaxley Festival 2017
Description: This is a project to hold the Yaxley community festival including May Day festivities, educational exhibitions, sports tournaments and workshops, an art competition and live music and performances. This will bring the community together to increase community spirit and engagement.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Music Workshops
Description: This group represent the Chinese community of South West London on appropriate matters of community concern  and promote Chinese culture, arts and tradition.The group want to run music workshops to be divided into two groups to cover Er-hu, a traditional classical Chinese instrument, and more modern Chinese music using electronic organs and piano's.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Didsbury Arts Festival 2009
Description: This group was established to develop the Didsbury Arts Festival, a week long festival that will create an opportunity for the local community to support and engage with the arts, at events held in a variety of public buildings. The festival will inspire local people to work together to foster a positive community image and vibrant culture, they will actively seek opportunities for intergenerational events, which they hope will be the legacy of the event.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Ross Live Outreach Programme
Description: This community group will use the award to provide multi-arts activities, such as break dance/hip-hop workshops, Irish dance workshops and drama.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Arts Workshops
Description: With help from a Lottery grant Epworth Wesley Day Celebrations will run a series of workshops for community groups in Epworth. These will be led by professional artists and will encourage participants to create artwork that celebrates local heritage and culture. All work will be put on display at the annual Wesley pageant in May 2007.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Felton Arts Group
Description: This arts group will use an award to purchase equipment so that members can develop their artistic skills. The group will also employ a qualified teacher to deliver arts workshops.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: African Linx at the Mill
Description: This group promotes and celebrates European and West African Arts, Music and Culture. This project will provide a weekend of music and dance, where musicians from other cultures will perform alongside those from the local community. There will also be workshops in music and dance, which will be available to all.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Canterbury Festival Carnival Parade
Description: This group promotes and advances the education of the public in the arts. The project will enable the group to stage a carnival parade as the opening event of the Canterbury Festival. This will be the result of workshops which will include various local community groups.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: The Art and Music Festival Workshops
Description: A project for events with workshops at five different festivals. Activities will include teaching young people juggling, acrobalance, diabolo, stilt walking and talks on issues relating to the environment, human rights and fair trade.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Celebration
Description: An award has been made to the Droylsden Phoenix over 50's Club that will allow them to  60th anniversary of WW2 celebration event.  The event will include music of the time and will also have a display of memorabilia.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Asian Dance and Music Event
Description: An indoor dance and music event is planned, providing opportunities in workshops, masterclasses and public shows with performances by amateur and semi-professionals, from a group which develops South Asian arts festivals. The grant is for venue hire, artists' fees, project management and co-ordination fees, evaluation and documentation, PR marketing and publicity, volunteers, security, technical cost, materials and refreshments.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Workshops
Description: This organisation runs a range of arts activities which incorporate Nigerian culture and traditions. This project is to run a two week colaborative workshop programme between AM Arts and Ikir Performing Group. The group of artists within this group specialise in dance and music associated with areas in west Africa that were involved in the slave trade.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Teen Sounds project
Description: Brighton Jazz All Stars aims to encourage more people to learn about and play Jazz and World music.  With help from a Lottery award it will be able to run workshops with young people from the Crew Club to develop a new music and performance piece.  This new work will be performed as part of the Brighton Festival and will include live music and poetry.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Connecting our Cross-Cultural Activities with UK City of Culture
Description: The grant will be used to run a series of cross-cultural workshops, tutorials and events, exploring music, song, verse and dance.  The project is already linked to a number of events in the UK City of Culture including All-Ireland Fleadh, All Ireland Scor, Highland Festival, Jazz & Blues Festival, Sean-Nos Singing Festival, Music City Day and the Walled City Tattoo.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Dashehra Diwali Mela 2016
Description: The organisation will use the funding to hold a Mela event in central Manchester involving participatory arts and crafts, dance and music workshops, a lantern procession and performances. This will bring people from diverse cultural and social backgrounds together.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: VJ Day Commemoration
Description: The 1945 Craven Street Youth Club will use their award to hold a reunion of its members to commemorate the 60th anniversary of VJ Day.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: V.J. Day Celebration Event
Description: The Paddock Wood and District Branch of the Royal British Legion will use their award to hold a service to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the end of the Second World War. The day will begin with a parade of ex-service organisations with the day culminating in a reception for all those involved.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Festival
Description: This group provides facilities for leisure and recreational activities. The project is to put on a festival to celebrate the opening of a new community centre. The festival will include a performance by a theatre company and workshops in various art forms will be provided to encourage more participation in the arts. The award is for costs towards artist fees, materials, travel costs, venue hire, publicity and volunteer expenses.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: theatrical performance and BBQ
Description: Vow Purple Star LOL 911 from County Antrim will use an award to hold a day-long celebration to mark the 60th Anniversary of WW2. The event will include a local youth group re-enacting an episode of Dad's Army on stage, and outdoor BBQ and a firework display.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Pakistan Day  Multicultural Celebrations
Description: This group have a membership of 150 and aim to promote community cohesion through workshops, events and activities. The group will use the funding for a Pakistan Day celebration event which will celebrate and promote Pakistani culture and heritage.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: VE and VJ Day event
Description: The Paddington branch of the Royal British Legion will use an award to host a service of remembrance and thanksgiving to commemorate the 60th anniversary of V.E. Day and V.J. Day.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Treasure Hunt and Concert
Description: The Aughintober Regeneration Group will use their award to carryout two events in celebration of the 60th anniversary of WW2.  The group will hold two community events with a 1940's theme, music from the era will be played and period dress will be worn.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: 10 year celebratory event
Description: A project to celebrate the 10th anniversary of this group, by providing a celebration day for members from Saltley, Washwood Heath, Ward End and Stechford, Birmingham. The grant will pay for hall, food, music and transport.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: 20th Anniversary celebration
Description: A project by this cultural group in Walsall to celebrate their  20th Anniversary by provision of a series of events, including art workshops for young people.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Black History Month project
Description: To co-incide with Black Project Month, the college will work with local artists to run a four day event at Hanger Farm Arts Centre promoting knowledge of Black History through various art forms, including drama, music, sculpture, poetry readings, storytelling, art, photography, drumming and dance workshops.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund

Title: Celebration
Description: The Hindon branch of the Royal British Legion will use an award to hold a range of activities to commemorate the 60th anniversary of WW2. This will include a dig for victory venture, a wartime tea party, historical talks, and an exhibition. The week of events will conclude with a celebration day, which will include a parade, re-enactments, a flying display and a Concert.
Funding Org:Name: The Big Lottery Fund
